title: A Sense of Place
summary: Explore a small exhibition of artworks in the Iris Murdoch Building, organised by the Art Collection and chosen from the University’s permanent collection.

title: Campus as Inspiration exhibition
summary: This exhibition highlights artistic responses in the medium of dance, sound and photography to portray the experience of being at Stirling.

title: Inspired! exhibition
summary: In 2023-24 our chosen focus is Inspired! in which we celebrate how our campus and collections have inspired creativity.

title: The Art of Willie Rodger exhibition
summary: See the works and the art that was inspired by established printmaker Willie Rodger in this exhibition.

title: Interior Dialogue exhibition
summary: Explore three pieces of work by Scottish artist Christine Borland at this exhibition in Pathfoot Building.

title: Welcome to University Collections
summary: Join us for an intro to the Art Collection where you'll have the chance to create your own work.

title: Art Collection Saturday opening
summary: Pop by the Pathfoot Building anytime between 10:00 to 14:30 on Saturday 10 February to view the exhibitions.

title: Movement exhibition
summary: Our Movement exhibition displays previously unseen artworks and archive material from our Collections which represent the kinetic energy and joy of movement in a variety of surprising ways.

title: The Valley exhibition launch
summary: Come along to our free exhibition where photographic work from Forth Valley College students will be on display.

title: Art Collection Open Day
summary: Come along to our Open Day to find out more about this year’s theme 'Inspired! Campus and Collections as Inspiration'.

title: Lino Print Workshop with Abbie Lois
summary: Spend an afternoon learning to lino print - suitable for beginners!

title: Campus Photography Workshop with Michael Prince
summary: Be inspired with our guided photography walk around the beautiful University of Stirling campus.

title: Curator’s Tour
summary: Join the Art Collection team for a relaxed and free tour of the current exhibitions.

title: Family Friendly Collage
summary: Create a mini postcard-sized collage and be inspired by our artists' incredible collection.

title: Nordic Viola – The Pathfoot Project Performance
summary: Students from the University of Stirling and the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland have come together to create work inspired by the exhibitions, and are joined by ensemble Nordic Viola.

title: Memoria Exhibition Launch
summary: Our Open Day will conclude with the formal opening of a new exhibition Memoria by University Artist in Residence Audrey Grant.

title: Memoria Exhibition
summary: Developed over Audrey Grant's year-long residency, Memoria considers and responds to the visible and invisible traces left in the landscape of the historic Airthrey Estate

title: Last chance curator’s tour
summary: Join the Art Collection curators for a last-chance tour of our Inspired! Exhibitions in the Pathfoot Building.

title: Faculty of Taking Notice Assembly: Meet our Artists in Residence
summary: Meet the University of Stirling Artists in Residence for 2024-25, Gardner & Gardner,  a husband and wife artist duo, at the Crush Hall.

title: Black History Month
summary: October is Black History Month, and every year we celebrate Black history, heritage and culture with a programme of events. This year's theme is 'Saluting our Sisters'.

title: Commit to change with Union Black
summary: University students and staff in the UK are still experiencing racial harassment and exclusion. Build confidence as a change agent for equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging with this short course.
timeAdvice: Take this short course at any time throughout Black History Month

title: The Stirling Story of Slavery and Empire
summary: Join this free tour of objects related to the Trans-Atlantic Slave Trade as part of The Smith's Black History Month tour series.
location: The Stirling Smith Art Gallery and Museum

title: The Stirling Story of Slavery and Empire
summary: Join this free tour of objects related to the Trans-Atlantic Slave Trade as part of The Smith's Black History Month tour series.
location: The Stirling Smith Art Gallery and Museum

title: Thomas Stuart Smith's Black Portraiture
summary: Join a tour of Thomas Stuart Smith’s portraits of black sitters. This tour will look at the stories behind the paintings of three unknown black men and explore how they represent complex portraits of race in Victorian Britain.
location: The Stirling Smith Art Gallery and Museum

title: Thomas Stuart Smith's Black Portraiture
summary: Join a tour of Thomas Stuart Smith’s portraits of black sitters. This tour will look at the stories behind the paintings of three unknown black men and explore how they represent complex portraits of race in Victorian Britain.
location: The Stirling Smith Art Gallery and Museum

title: Saluting our sisters at Stirling
summary: Join us for this live panel discussion featuring student, staff and alumni voices as we talk honestly about the experiences of black and minority ethnic women at the University of Stirling and in higher education.

title: Smoothie bike breakfast in the Atrium
summary: Start your morning with a quick sprint on the bike and bag yourself a smoothie at the end. No need to book, just come along.

summary: Come along to Massacre at Agincourt and hear from speaker Iain MacInnes from University of the Highlands and Islands.

summary: Legal Sightseeing webinar features speaker Renske Vos from Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.

title: Global Entrepreneurship Week discussion panel
summary: In celebration of Global Entrepreneurship Week 2023, don’t miss our public discussion panel featuring some of Scotland’s inspiring entrepreneurs.

title: Dumyat Hill Race
summary: The Dumyat Hill Race is the University of Stirling's flagship running event, and a popular fixture on the Scottish hill running calendar.

title: ESRC Festival of Social Science
summary: University of Stirling researchers are putting on an exciting programme of interactive public events on the latest innovations in social science. This is part of the ESRC Festival of Social Science, UK’s biggest celebration of social science research.

title: Art exhibition – managed alcohol programmes during COVID-19 pandemic
summary: Explore how the art reflects the themes from the study into managed alcohol programmes and how they helped improve participants’ health and wellbeing during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Undergraduate Open Day
summary: An Undergraduate Open Day is your golden opportunity to find out everything there is to know about life at the University of Stirling.

title: Undergraduate Virtual Open Day
summary: Our Virtual Open Day features a mix of presentations, videos and live chat. It also includes our Virtual Tour, which showcases our beautiful campus and facilities.

title: Scottish Cup 1st Round: University of Stirling FC vs Albion Rovers
summary: University of Stirling's men’s football team are playing in the First Round of the Scottish Cup on Mon 25 September against Albion Rovers.

title: Logie Kirk Lecture - Is democracy dead?
summary: The University of Stirling, in partnership with the Friends of Logie Kirk, is pleased to host an evening with BBC special correspondent James Naughtie.
location: Logie Lecture Theatre, University of Stirling

title: The important link between professional associations and the classroom
summary: Exploring how professional associations in the language industry play an important role for all stakeholders, regardless of how (in)experienced they are.
location: Pathfoot building, P.LTA96 or online via Teams
tags: Faculty of Arts and Humanities, Interpreting, Translation and Intercultural Studies

title: Behavioural Science and Digital Markets Regulation workshop
summary: A one-day workshop on Behavioural Science and Digital Markets Regulation, bringing together researchers and practitioners from the field.
location: Cottrell Building (enter through C Block entrance)

title: A day for nature
summary: Come to the University of Stirling and help to celebrate and advocate for the natural world.
tags: Faculty of Arts and Humanities, Art Collection

title: Postgraduate Open Day
summary: Our Postgraduate Open Days give you the perfect opportunity to find out more about studying at Stirling.

title: Virtual Postgraduate Open Day
summary: Our Virtual Open Day features a mix of presentations, videos and live chat. It also includes our virtual tour, which showcases our beautiful campus and facilities.

title: Native American history through newspapers
summary: Explore the role of print in Native American history and activism.

title: Derick Thomson, Gairm magazine and the Gaelic Revival
summary: Join Dr Petra Poncarová, from Charles University in Prague, in a research event that marks the publication of her monograph.

title: III Symposium on Current Trends in Consumer Research
summary: Join our III Symposium on Current Trends in Consumer Research hosted by Professor Cele Otnes at University of Stirling in May 2024.
location: Stirling Court Hotel, University of Stirling

title: Iain (M) Banks: Two Authors, One Man Exhibition Launch
summary: Learn about the life and legacy of one of our University's most renowned alumni. Enjoy free food, giveaways and creative activities at this launch event.

title: Screened Out
summary: Screened Out is a film and workshop programme that focusses on queer representation within modern cinema.
location: Creative Stirling Venue, 44 King Street, Stirling FK8 1AY
timeAdvice: Events take place across three dates. See programme for full time details

title: Scottish International Law Conference 2024: Human Rights Incorporation
summary: The 2024 edition of the Scottish International Law Conference series will focus on the theme of 'Human Rights Incorporation', exploring the incorporation of international human rights obligations into national law.

title: Undergraduate Open Day September 2024
summary: An Undergraduate Open Day is your golden opportunity to find out everything there is to know about life at the University of Stirling.

title: ESRC Festival of Social Science 2024
summary: University of Stirling researchers are putting on an exciting programme of interactive public events as part of the ESRC Festival of Social Science 2024, the UK’s biggest celebration of social science research.
location: Various locations across Stirling and central Scotland

title: Science of steps - a creative walk through nature revealing the science behind the benefits of a short stroll
summary: We all know how hard it can be to be physically active. This creative event will show how small changes in our daily physical activity can make a difference to our wellbeing and fitness. Learn about our physical activity research while walking a lap of the loch, exploring the beautiful surroundings of University of Stirling campus.
location: Crush Hall, Pathfoot Building, University of Stirling, FK9 4LA

title: Technology Taster Session for Seniors
summary: Have you ever wanted to try a new technology without having to buy it? If so then our drop-in session is perfect for you. Anyone over the age of 65 can come along to visit different stations and try a vast array of digital technologies.
location: Function Room, The Dunblane Centre, Stirling Road, FK16 6AB

title: Hopetown 2040 - Tackling a 'Tomorrow Problem'
summary: Come and play a serious game about tackling the ‘tomorrow problem’ of healthy ageing. Players will join teams to make decisions about services, housing and care for the residents of Hopetown. It's a fun way to experience the challenges and solutions of developing communities that support healthy ageing, which is a ‘tomorrow problem’ that will affect us all!
location: Iris Murdoch Building, University of Stirling, Stirling, FK9 4NF

title: Exploring our automated futures - AI, data and surveillance
summary: This two-hour interactive event offers a creative space to inform and critically explore issues and opportunities arising from digitally-mediated surveillance practices and systems which assist (or complicate) professional decision-making, strategy, and action across all sectors of human endeavour.
location: Iris Murdoch Building, University of Stirling, Stirling, FK9 4NF

title: Our Digital Bodies - Biometric Technologies and Data
summary: This interactive event offers a creative and collaborative space for citizens to share their perspectives on ‘Our Digital Bodies’ by exploring current and future uses of biometrics.
location: Queen Margaret Room, Dunfermline Carnegie Library and Galleries (DCLG), 1-7 Abbot Street, Dunfermline, KY12 7NL

title: Intergenerational digital ideas swap shop
summary: This two-hour workshop will offer a mix of in-person, online and hybrid activities to explore the idea of resilience and to share our experience of using technology to stay well and happy in our everyday lives.
location: In-person at the Iris Murdoch Building, University of Stirling, FK9 4NF or online

title: Autism through an Autistic Lens
summary: This event aims to bust common myths and stereotypes about autism. It includes a 45-minute interactive research talk by Sarah Dantas (event leader and main researcher) introducing the research project ‘Autism through an Autistic Lens’. The project engaged autistic adults in creatively expressing their experiences through photography.
location: Stirling Central Library, Corn Exchange Road, Stirling, FK8 2HX

title: After the Landslide - where next for UK politics and policy?
summary: This event brings together a panel of leading academic experts, activists, and thought leaders to reflect on the big challenges facing UK and devolved politicians over the coming quarter century.
location: Stirling Smith Art Gallery, 40 Albert Pl, Stirling, FK8 2RQ

title: Hidden Histories - digital approaches to the ‘lost’ stories of Alloa
summary: The exhibition is focused on bringing to life, through images and sounds, the experiences of older people who grew up in Alloa and the surrounding areas. It captures their life stories and through them will demonstrate the different ways that Alloa has changed in the last 120 years.
location: The Alloa Hub, Maple Court, Alloa FK10 1JX

title: Undergraduate Open Day October 2024
summary: An Undergraduate Open Day is your golden opportunity to find out everything there is to know about life at the University of Stirling.

title: Online Undergraduate Information Sessions
summary: At our online sessions we’ll take you through everything from advice on applying to funding your studies, and you'll hear from current students about living and studying at Stirling.

title: This Fragile Earth: Pioneer Scottish Artists who anticipated the climate crisis
summary: This exhibition focusses on a group of pioneering Scottish artists who as early as the 1970s and 1980s were responding to the threat of climate change.
timeAdvice: Galleries are open Monday – Friday, 09:00-17:00 or by appointment.

title: The Divine Sky - Sekai Machache
summary: Sekai Machache (she/they) is a Zimbabwean-Scottish visual artist and curator based in Glasgow. Her work is a deep interrogation of the notion of self and she is interested in the relationship between spirituality, imagination and the role of the artist in disseminating symbolic imagery to provide a space for healing.
timeAdvice: Galleries are open Monday – Friday, 09:00-17:00 or by appointment.

title: Remembering Together: Collective Creative Responses to the Pandemic
summary: This exhibition explores how two separate projects chose to make sense of the pandemic, reflecting on how we as a society remember and honour traumatic times.
timeAdvice: Galleries are open Monday – Friday, 09:00-17:00 or by appointment.

title: Margaret Mitchell: Six Works
summary: This series of six works, acquired by the University’s Art Collection in 2023, focus on Margaret Mitchell's nephew Steven, offering an insight into his life’s trajectory.
timeAdvice: Galleries are open Monday – Friday, 09:00-17:00 or by appointment.

title: Seven Women: Ken Currie
summary: In 2023 the University Art Collection was delighted to be gifted seven works by renowned artist Ken Currie and we are pleased to display Seven Women together in this exhibition.
timeAdvice: Galleries are open Monday – Friday, 09:00-17:00 or by appointment.

title: In and around campus - an exhibition by Peter Hancock
summary: To mark his retirement, Peter Hancock, a professor in Psychology at the University of Stirling, presents a selection of photographs taken in and around the university campus since his arrival in 1987.

title: Artist Talk: Margaret Mitchell
summary: In collaboration with the Stirling Photography Festival, Margaret will lead a talk exploring her practice and approach as well as offering us a first look at her work in the university collection.

title: Warm welcome to the Art Collection
summary: Come along to our Art Collection for an introduction to our collections, look around our store and see some hidden gems in our collection.

title: Doors Open Day
summary: Explore the iconic Pathfoot Building as part of Doors Open Day 2024.

title: Forest Bathing
summary: Experience the healing powers of nature through the practice of forest bathing on the beautiful University of Stirling campus.

title: Lino printing workshop
summary: Join Abbie Lois for a relaxed afternoon session of lino cutting and printing.

title: Memoria
summary: Developed over the course of Audrey Grant's year-long residency, Memoria explores the visible and invisible traces left on the historic Airthrey Estate landscape.

title: This Fragile Earth exhibition launch
summary: Join the University of Stirling Art Collection and the Fleming Collection to celebrate the launch of This Fragile Earth: How Scottish Artists Anticipated the Climate Crisis.

title: This Fragile Earth: creative writing workshops
summary: We want to get people thinking and writing about the earth and what matters to them. Everyone is welcome to join our creative writing workshop.

title: John Craxton: A Life of Gifts film screening
summary: A film screening and discussion of John Craxton: A Life of Gifts, a painter born into a famous musical family in 1922.

title: Yoga mini retreat
summary: Join us for a relaxing day of yoga and mindfulness at the beautiful University of Stirling campus.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season
summary: Learn more about what it’s like to be a postgraduate student at the University of Stirling. At our online sessions we’ll take you through everything from advice on studying with us, the support we provide and preparing for your career after graduating.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season: Accommodation Information Session
summary: Join our Accommodation Team for an insightful session on everything you need to know about student housing.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season: Careers and Employability Information Session
summary: Join our Careers and Employability Team to learn everything you need to know about the support they can provide you.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season: Student Immigration Team Information Session
summary: Join our Student Immigration Team to learn more about the student visa process.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season: Student Support Services Information Session
summary: Join our Student Support Services to learn more about the extensive range of support services they provide to help you fulfil your potential and make the most of your time studying with us.

title: Challenges and the Future of Minority and Indigenous Rights Protection Conference
summary: This conference will reflect on the rights of indigenous peoples and ethnic, religious and linguistic minorities, and the need to fundamentally rethink and recommit to their protection.

title: History, Heritage and Politics seminars
summary: Join our programme of History, Heritage and Politics seminars and learn about the latest research from University experts and guest speakers.

summary: Join speaker Dr Neil Crawford from the University of Stirling's research seminar on Visualising the Urban Climate Crisis in Uganda.

summary: Join speaker Dr Annalisa Christie from the University of Stirling and chair Dr Jennie Morgan from the University of Stirling on the subject of Introducing 'Giving Us Voice'.

summary: Join speaker Professor Emer George Peden and respondent Associate Professor Ian Cawood from the University of Stirling for this research seminar on Churchill, Chamberlain and Appeasement.

title: Dr Bike

title: Green and Blue space: snacks and chat
summary: Green and Blue space: smoothies, snacks and chat. Join us for tricycle smoothie making, community discussion and a planning session.

title: Staff walk
summary: Join us this Active Travel Week for the re-launch of our monthly staff walks, open to all staff but new staff are particularly encouraged.

title: Roadside repair workshop
summary: Our workshop will show you how to do simple roadside repairs to your bike. Get bike safety and repairs tips at Active Travel Week.

title: Sunrise stroll
summary: Join us for a sunrise stroll to the viewpoint at the Wallace Monument before heading back to campus for a hotel drink and bite to eat.

title: Centre of Environment, Heritage and Policy Seminar series
isSeries: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Join our regular seminar series and learn about some of the biggest and latest ideas in the area of Environment, Heritage and Policy.

title: Difficult monuments in theory and practice: the Nazi Monument at Stiklestad, Norway
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Join this talk by Torgrim Sneve Guttormsen as he discusses topics of heritage that are contentious and examines how public monuments become the focus of attention.
location: Online via Microsoft Teams, and in person at Room P.C22, Pathfoot Building

title: The era of climate capitalism and climate colonialism? A critical analysis of global climate finance governance
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Dr Hyeyoon Park introduces emerging issues of global inequality and justice in global climate finance governance in this seminar.

title: Being there. Inscription as memory practice in tourism and heritage
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Dr Sarah May considers how and why we inscribe ourselves into places that matter in this seminar.

title: Understanding seascapes as heritage-making geographies: the floating populations of Macao, in the Southeast Coast of China
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: The effects migrations between seascapes and landscapes have on heritage processes are discussed in this seminar presented by Mariana Pinto Leitão Pereira.

title: Graduation ball November 2024
summary: Get your ticket to the November 2024 Graduation Ball and celebrate your achievements.
location: Stirling Court Hotel, University of Stirling

title: 16 Days of Activism
summary: 16 Days of Activism against gender-based violence is an annual international campaign that starts on 25 November and runs until 10 December. Find out what's happening at the University of Stirling.
location: Various locations across campus and online

title: Gender-based violence information stalls
summary: Join us in the Atrium for stalls and information about gender-based violence.

title: Violence Against Women & Girls: The Unspoken Pandemic
summary: Why are we not naming what's happening? Join our guest talk on Violence Against Women & Girls: The Unspoken Pandemic.

title: Women only self-defence class
summary: Learn ways to defend yourself in this self-defence class.

title: Gender-based violence First Responder training
summary: Register for First Responder gender-based violence training.

summary: Take part in a march around the loch to raise awareness of gender-based violence.

title: Sexual Violence and Misconduct Liaison Officers information session
summary: Join our online session to learn more about Sexual Violence and Misconduct Liaison Officers and the role they play.

title: Misogyny in the media with Stirling Women's Aid
summary: Discover how media perpetuates stereotypes and how misogyny is happening in today's world.

title: Student First Responder training
summary: Part of a sports club or society? This session will help you know what to do if a member of your club or society experiences gender-based or sexual violence.

title: White Ribbon Scotland launch
summary: The formal launch of the White Ribbon Scotland campaign on campus.

title: Imagine a Stirling without GBV
summary: Join our session to discuss what the University is doing in relation to gender-based violence (GBV) support, training, culture change and intersectionality considerations.

title: Be Connected
summary:
Discover a programme of free events and activities for our Stirling community of students and staff.
Bookings for activities will open approximately four to six weeks before the event date.

title: Free Eco Craft Workshops
summary: Come along and try a range of crafty activities throughout the semester, free of charge, and meet new people while doing so!
location: Atrium Triangle or Room 3.04 (Campus Central Level 3)
timeAdvice: Check below for dates and times of each workshop

title: Welcome to the Enterprise Programme (online workshop)
summary: Learn about the entrepreneurial opportunities, training, events, incubation community, and funding available through our institution’s Enterprise Programme.

title: Halloween Extravaganza
summary: Pop along for an evening of spooky fun with friends at our brand new Be Connected event 'Halloween Extravaganza'

title: Celebrating Diwali: A Festival of Light
summary: Come along to celebrate a festival of light at the University of Stirling!

title: Paws Against Stress
summary: Open to all University of Stirling students and staff, join our first Paws Against Stress event, on Saturday 4 November, delivered by volunteers of Canine Concern Scotland Trust.

title: Global Café
summary: International students: come along and join us for tea or coffee, make friends, chat and play games.

title: Chappy's Chatty Hour
summary: Join Lesley, Chappy the bear, and friends for an hour of conversation and fun on a Friday lunchtime.

title: Christmas Light Switch On
summary: Join our Christmas extravaganza to kickstart your festive season. Enjoy live music, a seasonal market and free food and drink.

title: Festive Fun Day
summary: Join us in the Atrium from noon for a day of festive fun and a nod to Thanksgiving Day as part of our BeConnected programme.
timeAdvice: The event starts at noon and will run until stocks last.

title: Free Christmas Dinner
summary: This year all students living in university accommodation or private accommodation in Stirling will be able to tuck into a free Christmas Dinner on Christmas Day as part of our Be Connected programme.

title: Free movie nights for students
summary: Join your fellow students for free screenings throughout the semester in partnership with the Macrobert Arts Centre!
location: Macrobert Arts Centre, University of Stirling
timeAdvice: Film and timings for each event will vary.

title: Staff Festive Mixer
summary: Join the Christmas catch-up at Campus Central Level 3 for complimentary nibbles, festive activities, and a chance to win a hamper.
location:

title: University of Stirling Parkrun
summary: A free, fun, and friendly weekly 5k community event. Walk, jog, run, volunteer or spectate – it's up to you!

title: Study Abroad 101
summary: Learn about the opportunities to study abroad with your degree!

title: Big Games Nights
summary: Are you ready to  get thinking, meet new people, and work together? Come along to our brand new Big Games Nights this semester.
timeAdvice: Each event will run from 17:30 to 19:30.

title: Connecting Cultures
summary: Come along for a fun and informative evening to learn about Scottish culture and customs, try traditional snacks, and make new friends.
timeAdvice: Come along for refreshments from 5:30pm with the event starting at 6:00pm.

title: Mental Health Awareness Week
summary: In recognition of Mental Health Awareness Week, there are lots of events and activities taking place at the University of Stirling for staff and students to get involved with.

title: UV Zumba
summary: Get your dance on at Sports Hall 2 and Zumba the night away.

title: Hygge at Loch View
summary: Come along to Loch View Wellbeing Suite to find your hygge.
location: Loch View Wellbeing Suite, 2A1 Cottrell Building

title: Mindful pebble painting
summary: Pop along to take part in a mindful pebble painting activity.
location: Atrium, in front of the security office

title: Neurodiversity and your career journey
summary: Designed for neurodiverse students to find out more about our Careers Service and get support.

title: Build your confidence in how to improve your interview technique
summary: Prepare for an interview with this interactive masterclass for undergraduate students.

title: Identifying and managing my stress
summary: Develop a personal practical plan to minimise your stress in our stress management workshops for staff.

title: Identifying and managing my stress
summary: Develop a personal practical plan to minimise your stress in our stress management workshops for staff.

title: Identifying and managing my stress
summary: Develop a personal practical plan to minimise your stress in our stress management workshops for staff.

title: Loch View's panel discussion - self limiting beliefs
summary: A discussion on self-limiting beliefs - find out how they impact us and how we can overcome them.

title: Staff walk
summary: Take time to get some fresh air and a break from your screen with our lunchtime staff walk.
location: Meet at the accommodation side of the loch bridge

title: #IamRemarkable
summary: Boost your self-promotion with Emily Sandwell, International Careers Consultant in an #IamRemarkable workshop.

title: LGBTQ+: working it out
summary: A discussion about being authentic at work, join us to share your thoughts and talk about your rights.

title: Community garden session
summary: Visit our community garden and feel the benefits of getting outside - it's also a great way to make new friends.

title: Student walk around campus
summary: Meet at the sport reception for a student walk around campus.

title: Make your own paper flower
summary: Take a break from your studies and create a paper flower with fellow students.

title: Stress/resilience workshop
summary: Learn about stress and resilience in this workshop and how we can improve our wellbeing.

title: Student yoga session
summary: Escape into the world of yoga for 30 minutes at our student yoga session.

title: Staff art tour
summary: Free lunchtime art tour of the Pathfoot exhibitions 'Inspired!'.

title: Launching Loch View’s Book Club (not your average book club)
summary: Love books and reading? Come along to our first Loch View Book Club.
location: Loch View Wellbeing Suite, 2A1 Cottrell Building

title: Places of peace on campus
summary: Join us on a mindful lunchtime walk to the Labyrinth for some quiet reflection time.
location: Chaplaincy, Loch View Wellbeing Suite, 2A1 Cottrell Building

title: Chappy Chatty Hour
summary: Chappy's Chatty Hour at the Chaplaincy is where you can craft, play games, have a chat or just take a break.
location: Chaplaincy, Loch View Wellbeing Suite, 2A1 Cottrell Building

title: Build your confidence in how to improve your interview technique
summary: Prepare for an interview with this interactive masterclass for postgraduate students.

title: Climate Cafe
summary: Join our Climate Cafe, an in-person gathering where people can express their feelings and fears about the climate and ecological crisis.
location: Meet at the Green and Blue Space, near the Atrium

title: Wellbeing Week
summary: Celebrate all things wellbeing with our special programme of activities and events.

title: Free movie evening for students
summary: Enjoy one of the latest blockbusters for free at the Macrobert Arts Centre.

title: Volunteering fayre
summary: Embark on a journey of impact and self-discovery at our Volunteering Fayre. Connect with local organisations to uncover unique opportunities that resonate with your interests and passions. Explore how volunteering is a powerful catalyst for mental health and wellbeing, fostering a sense of purpose and community. Your path to making a difference starts here!

title: Loch View Wellbeing Day
summary: Attend our wellbeing fair where you will find stalls dedicated to Sleeping better, Busting Stress and Living happier, information and giveaways galore! We will host 3 mini talks throughout the day in our Acorn Room (Loch View), and all students who attend will be able to get a free soup following the session. No need to book.

title: Badminton drop in
summary: Come along for a drop in badminton session for staff in the sports hall. Rackets and shuttles all supplied. Bring colleagues or come down on your own to have a hit with one of the team here! Social singles and doubles is the order of play.

title: Just play pickleball
summary: Come along to sports hall 2 and take part in a game of pickleball with friends or other students. Pickleball is a fun racket sport that combines elements of tennis, table tennis, and badminton, suitable for all abilities!

title: Lochside Yoga
summary: Join Eve for an energising yoga flow beside the beautiful loch and feel the benefits for the rest of the day.  We recommend dressing warm. All levels welcome.

title: Lochside Yoga
summary: Join Eve for an energising yoga flow beside the beautiful loch and feel the benefits for the rest of the day.  We recommend dressing warm. All levels welcome.

title: Leading first aid for mental health course
summary: This interactive two-day course will give candidates the skills to recognise when someone may need help and outline the appropriate next steps to take. They will know how to start a supportive conversation and when and how to signpost a person to seek appropriate professional help. Learners will understand mental health, how to provide practical support, recognise and manage stress and support staff with implementing plans to improve mental health culture in the workplace.
timeAdvice: Delegates must attend both days to receive accreditation

title: Evening HIIT workout
summary: A High Intensity Interval Training session that will focus on building stamina and strength, gaining mobility all within your space.

title: DanceFit
summary: DanceFit is a fitness class with a dance element easy to follow routines to different genres of music for everyone to enjoy!

title: Feel good movement
summary: This mobility and movement-based session is designed to enhance joint health, alleviate muscle tension, and leave you feeling revitalised.

title: Planning for your future retirement workshop
summary: Our ‘Planning For Your Future Retirement’ workshops are delivered by Age Scotland and enable our staff who are over 50 to better prepare for later life after work. The workshop provides independent and impartial advice for planning for your retirement.

title: Financial wellbeing webinar
summary: This short workshop covers a wide range of issues relevant to planning your financial affairs both now and for your future. The webinar is open to any member of staff who has an interest in planning their finances to achieve their personal and financial goals.

title: Desk mobility session
summary: Say goodbye to the sedentary slump and embrace a dynamic session designed to counter the effects of prolonged desk sitting.

title: Yoga basics
summary: You don’t have to be super-flexible or have a certain level of fitness for this session. Yoga basics is designed with all abilities in mind.

title: Positive painting
summary: Join us in the Atrium to have a break from work or studies, relax with others, and paint positive thoughts. No need to pre-book, just come along.

title: Pickleball drop in
summary: Come along for a drop in pickleball session for staff in the sports hall. All equipment supplied, bring colleagues or come down on your own to have a hit with one of the team here! Learn how to play one of the world's fastest growing sports!

title: Loch walk
summary: Grab your colleagues and come join us for a mindful walk around the university loch. Great opportunity for a well-earned screen break.

title: Wellbeing Week gardening session
summary: Join the Students’ Union’s Sustainability Development Coordinator for a revitalizing community gardening session! Cultivate positivity and nurture your mental well-being through hands-on gardening activities. Connect with fellow green enthusiasts, learn gardening tips, and sow the seeds of relaxation. Embrace the therapeutic benefits of nature in this uplifting and communal experience. No sign up required, just come along to the Community Garden.

title: Guided journalling
summary: The benefits of journalling are numerous and there are many ways to journal. Join us for this real time guided journalling session. Learn more about the benefits of journalling to our wellbeing and the different ways to engage in this practice. The session is free and no booking is required.
location: Acorn Room, Loch View, 2A1 Cottrell Building

title: Strength and conditioning drop in session
summary: Drop-in session for staff in our high-performance gym areas. For non-sports centre members of staff, please make sure you familiarise yourself with our gym induction video and how to use our facilities.

title: Just play tennis
summary: Fancy a game of tennis with friends or other students? Join us for a casual game of tennis in a friendly, inclusive environment. We`ll give you the opportunity to play various students within the session. Open to all students, equipment provided.

title: 80's indoor cycle
summary: Join us for an 80's themed indoor cycle. Cycle back in time to the 80's! This will be a highly effective cardio and strength workout. Ride through hills, flats and sprints to the rhythm of some 80s classics.

title: Just play cricket
summary: Come along, join a team, and play a fun game of indoor cricket in sports hall 1. The session will be led by one of our Student Sport Activity Leaders who will allocate you to teams. Equipment will be provided!

title: February quiz night
summary: Come and join us for our February quiz night! Catch up with your Careers Service, eat some snacks and win one of our awesome prizes. The theme of this quiz is all things Leap Year.

title: Digital detox mixer: unplug, connect, relax!
summary: Come to the Students’ Union for a screen-free escape from the study grind! Leave your devices behind and immerse yourself in board games, art, and mindful moments. No need to sign up in advance, just come along and stay for as long as you like.

title: Mindfulness
summary: Join our fabulous Mental Health and Counselling Team for a guided mindfulness session. This is perfect opportunity to press pause on your day and take a break for your wellbeing. No need to book!
location: Acorn Room, Loch View, 2A1 Cottrell Building

title: Yoga at Juniper Court accommodation
summary: Join us at Juniper Court accomodation for a student yoga class. The class will take place in the social spaces downstairs, students from all halls welcome. All levels welcome, calm your body and mind with a relaxing yoga flow.

title: Table tennis drop in
summary: Come along for a drop in table tennis session for staff in the sports hall. All equipment supplied, bring colleagues or come down on your own to have a hit with one of the team here! It's the perfect social sport.

title: Introduction to meditation
summary: Open to all levels and no experience necessary. Learn the art of complete breathing and train your ability to meditate. Expect to be better able to manage stress and experience clarity and focus. Wear warm and comfy clothes.

title: Wellbeing walk to the Labyrinth
summary: Take 40 minutes of your day to slow down and notice nature on our wellbeing walk to the Labyrinth.

title: Wellbeing walk to the Labyrinth
summary: Take 40 minutes of your day to slow down and notice nature on our wellbeing walk to the Labyrinth.

title: Chappy’s Chatty Hour in the Chaplaincy
summary: Try crafting and meet new people with Lesley and Chappy the bear in the Chaplaincy.

title: Achieving a healthy weight workshop
summary: Discover how to take a healthy approach to managing weight in this 40-minute workshop.

title: Back care and posture workshop
summary: Discover tips on how to prevent and manage back pain in this one-hour workshop.

title: Wellbeing stalls
summary: Visit our stall on campus for wellbeing information.

title: Wellbeing stalls
summary: Visit our stall on campus for wellbeing information.

title: Wellbeing stalls
summary: Visit our stall on campus for wellbeing information.

title: Baha’i meditation
summary: Unwind at lunchtime with a 30-minute meditation based on Baha’i teachings.

title: Global Café: 5 Ways of Wellbeing
summary: Join us for a wellbeing-themed Global Café! This is a fun and relaxed place where international students can meet friends from Scotland and around the world.

title: International introduction to Stirling
summary: Meet our International Recruitment Team to find out more about the University of Stirling, and get some advice about how to submit your application.
isSeries: Country Specific Webinars, International Student Webinars

summary: Join us to find out more about our Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Computing and AI, and Big Data courses, and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.

title: MSc Environmental Management
summary: Join us to find out more about our MSc Environmental Management and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.

title: Scholarships and funding for international students
summary: Join our International Recruitment Team to find out about the scholarship opportunities available to you as an international student, and get some guidance on how to apply for funding.

summary: Join us to find out more about our MSc Financial Technology (FinTech) and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.

title: MSc Dementia Studies
summary: Join us to find out more about our MSc Dementia Studies and get answers to any questions you have about studying at Stirling.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season
summary:
A series of online events throughout October 2024 for postgraduate students to learn more on topics such as accommodation, careers, student support, and the student visa process.

Sign up for all sessions or just the ones you want.

title: Postgraduate accommodation information session
summary: Join our Accommodation Team for an insightful session on everything you need to know about student housing. Discover the variety of accommodation options available, learn how to navigate the application process, and get answers to all your questions about living on campus.

title: MSc Data Science for Business
summary: Join us to find out more about our MSc Data Science for Business.

title: Postgraduate careers and employability information session
summary: Join our Careers and Employability Team to learn everything you need to know about the support they can provide you. Our students gain more than a degree. From internships to helping find a job, the Careers Service gives you the support and advice you need to plan your career, develop your employability or think about further study.

title: MSc Public Relations and Strategic Communication (Online)
summary: Join Course Director, Dr Will Dinan, to find out more about our MSc Public Relations and Strategic Communication (Online) and get answers to any questions you have about studying at Stirling.

title: MSc Sport Management
summary: Join us to find out more about our MSc Sport Management and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.

title: Postgraduate Student Immigration Team information session
summary: Join our Student Immigration Team to learn more about the student visa process. Discover the steps you might need to take in order to prepare for your studies and to ask any questions you might have.

title: LLM/MSc Human Rights and Diplomacy
summary: Join us to find out more about our LLM/MSc Human Rights and Diplomacy and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.

title: Postgraduate Student Support Services information session
summary: Join our Student Support Services team to learn more about the extensive range of support services they provide to help you fulfil your potential and make the most of your time studying with us. Whether you feel like you’re thriving or in need of a helping hand, our dedicated student support team is here to listen, offer guidance and point you in the right direction at every turn.

title: Postgraduate tuition fees and funding for UK students
summary: Join our UK Recruitment Team for this session to learn more about paying your tuition fees, how to apply for funding, and scholarships you may be eligible for as a postgraduate student from the UK. This webinar also includes advice that may be relevant to students from the Republic of Ireland.

title: Introduction to Stirling for students living in an EU country
summary: Join our Europe Team to learn more about the University of Stirling and get some advice on submitting your application.
isSeries: Country Specific Webinars, International Student Webinars

title: Marketing courses

summary: Find out more about our BA (Hons) / BSc (Hons) Psychology and get answers to any questions you might have about undergraduate study at Stirling.
